text: <@U4H19D1D2> Can you expand on this "the ability to know if the market has moved right at the point of matching is very valuable.. HFT guys would kill for this" ? I am somewhat confused as to how this is helpful. I mean if you match at a larger price than you ask for you assume the market has drifted and if you don't get matched immediately (or after IP lag) then you know the market price has come in. If subject to a IP delay, the stream will update you on the market movement during that delay. I get the feeling I am missing something and I am not sure if it's something obvious or something very subtle?

elements.text: Can you expand on this "the ability to know if the market has moved right at the point of matching is very valuable.. HFT guys would kill for this" ? I am somewhat confused as to how this is helpful. I mean if you match at a larger price than you ask for you assume the market has drifted and if you don't get matched immediately (or after IP lag) then you know the market price has come in. If subject to a IP delay, the stream will update you on the market movement during that delay. I get the feeling I am missing something and I am not sure if it's something obvious or something very subtle?

text: <@UPMUFSGCR> For me it's been broken for ages. It displays the correct values for each market but somehow fails to add them up correctly. I've had to use the API for ages now to get accurate daily P&L. Strangely though it seems to be accurate on the web page for losses. I have also heard that on the phone app it is reliable but for me using either chromium or firefox browsers it has been broken for well over a month.

text: I have some node scripts that I use that allows me to extract profits by event type/strategy ref and pattern match by event names so I can drill down very easily. I use the event type ID one for daily P&L. I don't use bflw either but its just basic API listClearedOrders operation so you should be able to code it yourself easily. I can give you my scripts if you want but its rather clunky (6 CLI args) and just dumps to console so you might be better off writing one as part of your own setup.

text: I've always had some issues with the commission it seems to return the entire market commission even when you split by strategy ref. So I can see a losing race with respect to particular strategy ref but still have positive commission reported. I personally calculate commission myself per strategy as otherwise you think you are worse off than you actually are if you look at it at face value.

text: <@UBS7QANF3> and <@U4H19D1D2> why would getting the commission for a single bet not make sense (ignoring if is actually possible to do)? I thought it was as simple as if you make money off a bet bf take a given percentage off your winnings? Are you saying commission is calculated from a given amount of winnings over all bets placed on a market?

elements.text: and

why would getting the commission for a single bet not make sense (ignoring if is actually possible to do)? I thought it was as simple as if you make money off a bet bf take a given percentage off your winnings? Are you saying commission is calculated from a given amount of winnings over all bets placed on a market?

text: Commission is a percentage of your profit on a market

elements.text: Commission is a percentage of your profit on a market

text: Depending on your expected margins and number of trades per market you could compute some kind of "worse-than-reality-but-close-enough" where you remove commission from all winning bet profits. Just assume some worst case %. Obviously doesn't make sense if you're doing some Hft-style stuff. (Edited for clarity)

elements.text: Depending on your expected margins and number of trades per market you could compute some kind of "worse-than-reality-but-close-enough" where you remove commission from all winning bet profits. Just assume some worst case %. Obviously doesn't make sense if you're doing some Hft-style stuff. (Edited for clarity)

text: Note that if you aggregate commission by EVENT or EVENT_TYPE, there is a bug in the computation of commission from Betfair's side. This is reported to the BDP team but still not resolved.
